resources.string: The construction of World Trade Park Jaipur is worth Rs. 350 crores. The construction took two years for its development. The building has two different blocks; one in North and other in South, separated by city street. The two buildings are joined by a bridge, which has restaurants
World Trade Park Jaipur was inaugurated by the Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan in 2012.

World Trade Park Jaipur includes a display system where 24 projectors create a single image on its ceiling. This is the first system of its kind in the world.[citation needed] WTP was award (Mall of the Year) and (Best Architect) by BCI India.[citation needed] World Trade Park, Jaipur is the second-largest shopping mall in India by size (2,400,000 sq ft (220,000 m²) gross leasable area).
World Trade Park is a shopping mall in Malviya Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan, India. It opened at the end of 2012

Jaipur, the capital of the state of Rajasthan, was founded on 18 November 1727, by Raja Sawai Singh II. It is one of the planned cities of India and is a principal tourist destination. It is filled with ancient forts and monuments that boast of its glorious past. A large number of temples and other religious places reflect the spiritual value of the dynasties of the past, who built them. Apart from the forts and temples, a good number of gardens also enhance the effervescent beauty of Jaipur.

A pre-historic Hindu pilgrimage site, the Galtaji Temple, is located only 10km away from Jaipur. One of the jewels of Jaipur, the temple complex encompasses natural fresh water springs and 7 holy ‘kunds' or water tanks. Among these kunds, the ‘Galta Kund', is the holiest one and is believed to never get dry.

The Birla Temple, originally known as Lakshmi Narayan Temple, and is situated below the Moti Dungri Fort in Jaipur. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi, this temple is a proud architectural landmark of Jaipur. Built in pure white marble, the Birla Temple is unlike the traditional ancient Hindu temples, and is built with a modern approach.

The temple of Govind Dev Ji is one of the most sacred and famous tourist destinations in India. It is located in the City Palace complex, in Jaipur, Rajasthan. The deity, Govind Dev Ji, is none other than Lord Shri Krishna himself. It is believed that the image in this temple looks exactly how Lord Krishna looked during his incarnation on earth.
The Jewel of Jaipur, Rambagh Palace truly lives up to this name as it is one of the most beautiful palaces in India.
Forming an impressive backdrop of Jaipur is the humongous Nahargarh fort. It was built by Jai Singh for the protection of Amer in 1734
The Jaigarh Fort is the most imposing and spectacular fort that overlooks Jaipur. It is famous for the Jaivana canon, considered the largest canon in the world.…
Hawa Mahal or the Palace of winds was built by Sawai Pratap Singh in 1747. It has latticed windows that allowed royal ladies to have view
Albert Hall Museum is one of the oldest museums in Rajasthan. Located amidst Ram Niwas Garden in Jaipur, the Albert Hall Museum houses a collection of rare paintings

During this temple tour, you will explore the beauty, culture and traditions of three of Shimla's most famous temples. Follow your expert guide through the city streets and visit most famous temples Jakhoo, Kalibari and the Sankat mochan. Learn about the architecture, beliefs and local heritage as you explore and enjoy an Indian breakfast before returning to your hotel.

Legend and myth suggests that the monkey Lord Hanuman rested here while on his search for the Sanjivini Booti (a kind of herb). He met sage Yaaku on the hilltop and then moved ahead in his journey. It is also believed that the sage built this temple. Devotees from all over the country come here, especially at the time of Dussehra festival celebrations.

Visit Tara Devi Temple and enjoy sweeping views of the Himalaya valley and verdant peaks beyond. Relax in the peaceful surroundings and serene atmosphere of the temple, built over 250 years ago atop a lush hill. Remember to remove your shoes upon entry to the site, and beware the light-fingered monkeys in the area, who apparently won't hesitate to take your phone.

Hatkoti Temple in Shimla, dedicated to Goddess Durga and Lord Shiva, is one of the main tourist attractions in and around Shimla. Lying along the River Pabbar, at village Hatkoti of tehsil Jubbal 104 km from Shimla, the temple is believed to be the spot where the gods fought a pitched battle. The spot is famous for ancient temple of Mata Hateswari in the midst of paddy fields on the right bank of the Pabber River.

This is the most popular point in Shimla. Located on the Mall road, at the heart of Shimla, this is a much loved and enjoyed stretch here, where visitors come and soak themselves in the views of surrounding areas.
Shopping in Shimla revolves around the heart of the town- The Mall Road. One can shop for local handicrafts, shawls, woolens, exquisite jewelry etc. here.

While in Shimla, visit its colder, higher and less crowded cousin, Kufri just 13 km away from the main town. The views and sceneries here only get better, and the landscapes more flattering, a bit untouched with the tourist rush.
2.Tickets: 20INR for Indians,100INR for foreingner plus 50INR(Indians) and 100INR(Foreigner) for photography.
3.Opening Timings: Open all days except Monday from 10am to 5pm.

The SHIMLA STATE MUSEUM is situated at the top of Mount Pleasent. Also known as Himachal State Museum and Library, it was built in the year 1974. It was constructed to preserve the cultural richness of the state and to record its rich past.
Here you can search for the location
Just enter the name of the location.
List of Some Top Malls in India

Lulu International Mall gives you the feel of an international mega mall. Its roof shines in sunlight. Total Floors 5 Total Multiplex 9 Screen of PVR Cinemas Multiplex Food 3 Restaurants and 4500 People can take food at a time with 18 multi cuisine kitchens. Facilities for Entertainment Party Hall, Indoor Climbing, Rides, Amusement, 5D Cinema and Arcade Games Business Facilities Foreign Exchange Counters, Banking Counters and much more. Started in 2013, the mall has nearly 365 outlet shops.

Select City Walk opened in 2007, is the ninth largest mall in India. The best part of this mall is that it is divided into three traditional areas for the Staple Traditional family, Celebration centre-stage and High Voltage youth. It has over 125 stores and several Indian and global brands.

Phoenix Market City is actually a city in itself. Total area 4,000,000 square makes Phoenix Market City Mumbai is the largest mall in India and also in Asia. Total Stores 600 Retail Outlet/Stores Multiplex Screen 14 Movie Screens Restaurants More than 20 Restaurants

Elante Mall is a shopping mall in the city of Chandigarh in India. With the gross leasable area of 1,150,000 sqft, it is the second largest shopping mall in Northern India and the third largest in India. Elante Mall hosts ious Indian and international brands like Big Bazaar, Westside, Pantaloons, Lifestyle and Gucci among others. The Mall also has an 8-screen.
